A bit of road noise during the day but beautifully quiet at night with magic views of Lake Hawea and the mountains. Not sure how suitable it would be for big rigs but ok for vans. Enjoy.

name: Caltex Wānaka
description: Caltex will fill up your LPG tanks on the spot, large or small

name: Tucker Bar & Eater
description: Great food and drinks at this small and friendly restaurant. Tirau is quite a touristy town, this place was full of locals. They know where to eat.  Fresh and tasty.

name: Waikete Valley Thermal Pools
description:
Nice little campground with powered, non-powered and tent sites. Small kitchen and toilets at site, showers at the pool- area.
Camping includes unlimited use of the outside public pools (natural mineral water out of a boiling spring)
Powered: 32,- NZD/pp
Non-powered: 27,- NZD/pp

name: Hannahs Clearing...
description: Quite,hidden spot at the beach! No facilities,no water,no toilets! Freedom camping just for selfcontained vehicles only!

name: Wastebusters
description: Wastebusters is an excellent recycling depot and second hand store where you can drop off goods and pick up lots of different things at very good prices. Clothing, homeware, ski gear, bicycles, sports and camping equipment, timber, scrap metal, you name it. Open 9am - 5pm every day.

name: The Washstation
description:
The Washstation has self service coin operated laundromats at the back of the car wash station. There is a money changing machine to get $1 or $2 coins for the washers and dryers. You can also buy laundry powder for $2. 

Washers $5 small / $10 large 
Dryers $5 

Clean, modern facilities. Open 6am - 10pm daily.

name: Timaru Creek
description: Certified SC freedom camping spot on the edge of Lake Hawea. Follow the gravel road around the east side of the lake past Lake Hawea station until you see a sign for Picnic & Camping Area. Lots of space nestled in under gum trees with pit toilets (bring your own loo paper) and fire pits. Beautiful spot, incredibly quiet and great for stargazing. Good phone reception. Due to the terrain NOT recommended on wet/muddy days.

name: Mt Kakepuku
description:
Free campground for SC véhicules, no tents allowed you must be fully self sufficient. 
Quiet parking  lot at the entry of a 1h30 walk to the summit of mount kakepuku. 
Bathrooms are located 30meters into the walk. 
You can stay a maximum of 3 nights in a 30 days period. 
No water, good cellphone reception. 
Alright for a night.

name: Coopers Beach
description:
Beautiful location by the beach of Coopers Beach. WC, currency exchange booth and children's playground. Presence of camping tables. No sign prohibiting parking for the night.
.....
Magnifique emplacement au bord de la plage de Coopers Beach. WC, cabine de change et aire de jeux pour enfants. Présence de tables de camping.Pas de panneau interdisant de stationner pour la nuit.

name: Along the river
description: on a very accessible Gravel road, wide low side along the river.  some houses 2 km away but no disturbance.  Quiet night and waking up with a wonderful mist.

name: Te Paki Carpark
description:
dump station and filling of non-drinking water. Take the path that leads to the Giant sand dunes.
---
station de vidange et remplissage d'eau non potable. Prendre le chemin qui mène aux Giant sand dunes.

name: Free camping with Toilets
description: Free camping on a Huge grass field with a toilet. Very quiet at night. Two bars 3G cell service.

name: Lowther Picnic Stop
description: Picnic stop along the highway. No facilities except picnic tables. Nice pull-outs and fairly secluded from the highway. We stayed the night here after running into darkness between Te Anau and Queenstown.

name: Albert Town Campground
description: Established campground 10 minutes from Wanaka. $10 ppn, which is great value. Self service check-in. Card payments possible. Nice location overlooking the Clutha river. The other part of the campground is located across the street and overlooks the Hawea river. $7 ppn on that side.

name: Wanaka public dump station
description: Dump station, drinking water and garbage receptacles.

name: Large flat spot on the road to Jackson Bay
description: Nothing fancy, just a large rocky flat spot with some trees and bushes. Close to Arawhata river, so plenty of sandflies around.

name: Haast Dump Station
description: Public dump station and fresh water. Waste bins also provided.

name: Hokitika Public dump station
description: Public dump station 2kms outside of Hokitika with fresh water available.

name: Opposite from marawhara track entrance
description: Road side camping, one of the only parking spot in Piha that isn't prohibited for wild camping. Which is why I would only stay the night. No amenities, you can go to one of the beach houses for toilets.

name: Miranda Holiday park
description: Holiday park with a lot of amenities. Organised camping for regular tents and big rigs

name: West Oxford reserve campground
description: Lovely campground. Could easily ask some money for this, but it is free! We didn’t stay because there had been heavy rainfall during the day, causing most of the grass sites to be flooded. Close to the road, so probably some traffic noise. Self Contained Vehicles only, even though there are toilets available.

name: Cust Domain campsite
description: Informal campsite near Cust. Playground for the kids, a large playing field and toilets available. Certified Self Contained vehicles only. Very quiet!

name: Springfield public dump station
description: Springfield public dump station. No fresh/potable water. Small campground nearby, too.

name: Hawkes lookout car park
description: DOC managed car park. Stunning views from the lookout 300m further. Certified self contained vehicles only.

name: Waipu Caves
description: Free campsite, sign allows for just one overnight stay. Bathrooms available and just a short walk to the caves! Gravel road into location, can have a fire with a permit.

name: Skatepark Jack Pringle Park
description: Free drinking water at the skatepark, parking on the side

name: Kawakawa playground
description: Free water at the Kawakawa playground, public toilets and dumping station

name: Cap Reinga
description: Parking + dumping station at Cap Reinga, on the side of the road

name: Kerikeri Basin Recreation Reserve
description: Parking of the reserve, toilets open 24/7, no tents allowed

name: Centennial Park Welsford
description: Dumping station near the park, cute ducks aswell

name: Skatepark Ray Small Park Papakura
description: Water and toilets at the park. The parking is closing at night but we were parked before they closed so we slept on it.

name: Overnight campervan at Government Gardens
description: Parking lot for campervans near the Polynesian spa. Bins. Toilets nearby (closing at night). 14 spots must arrive early. midday or earlier

name: Hukuwai Beach Recreation Reserve
description: Overnight camping along the beach, toilets, warm shower if you ask

name: Opotiki i-Site
description:
Hot shower for 3$ at the tourist information
Free toilets

Mon-Fri : 9am - 4:30pm
Weekends : 9am - 1pm

name: i-site
description: Free wifi at the tourism information, doesn't work during the closed hours (around 4pm). Water at the skatepark in front. Toilets.

name: Gisborne dumping station
description: Dumping station and potable water, along the road, before the fuel station

name: Dumping station + potable water
description: Dumping station and potable water, along the road, before the fuel station

name: Midway beach parking
description: For self-contained vehicules only, 3 nights maximum stay. Pit toilets. Olympic pool in front where you can shower for 1$ (+ 20 cents the 3 minutes of hot water). Bins.

name: Olympic pool
description: Hot showers at the pool, 1$ to enter, then 20ct each 3 minutes to get warm water. No privacy, it's open showers (the one you get after going to the pool) but clean and warm.

name: sunset over the bay. amazing views
description: amazing pull off just off the road. no cars pass by so extremely quiet and peaceful. lots of room for multiple cars. flat. easy to access. no 4wd needed. Great views of the bay and awesome sunset. internet is good with vodaphone

name: Eastbourne street west car park
description: Level city centre car park, free overnight from 5pm to 9am, hourly rate otherwise, free on Sundays. Quite noisy due to city centre noise, bin lorry at 5.30am and train at 6.15am. Some shade. Good bars etc nearby.

name: Castlepoint car park
description: Small level car park in beautiful position overlooking Lighthouse, cove and beach. Bit tight for large campervans.

name: Maturi domain
description:
Informal campsite at the Maturi domain. Large open field with mature trees and river on one side. Club rooms have toilets at the rear, available to the public. Very quiet, pleasant site.  Only self-contained vehicles.
There is no charge.

name: Hopi Bush reserve
description:
Down a quiet country road you will find this reserve signposted. Drive a short distance through the gate to the picnic area. Here you can camp. A further short distance are toilets (not in good condition when we were here) as well as a water tap. This is also near the sign-posted start of the lovely bush.
Self-contained vehicles only.  No charge for camping here.

name: Aniwaniwa road campsite
description: Wild camp just of the Aniwaniwa road, about 500m from the main road. Nice grassy flat area beside the river. Very quiet and sheltered. The river has steep banks which make it difficult to reach. There are public toilets at the intersection with the main road, otherwise no facilities, so you need to be self-contained.

name: Mokau Camping Area
description:
Campsite right next to the lake. Longdrop toilets and washrooms.  Both tents and caravans/motor and permitted.
You can swim in the lake too.

name: Okahu road-end campsite
description:
About 10km from the main road you'll find a nice grassed area suitable for camping. This is where the dirt road ends and a shared track (trampers and mountain bikers) starts.
Long drop toilets and water from the river. Surrounded by bush. Sheltered.

name: Mid Okahu road campsite
description: Large DOC campsite about 3km from the main road. Alongside the river. Plenty of space with flat grass areas. Nice spot.

name: Te Iringi campsite
description: DOC campsite just off Clements Mill road in Kaimanawai forest park.  In beech forest.

name: Earl's Paradise
description: Terraced views over the village and the Pacific. Small campground, very nice and friendly owner !!! Suitable for vans and tents. Electricity, hot showers, water. 20  $ p. adult 10 min to the beach.

name: Orange Sheep Campervan Park
description:
Hands down, best (low cost) campground I’ve ever been to! 
Very cute little spots to park your car in, all facilities are clean and well equipped and the owner is super friendly and helpful! All types of vehicles are welcome. $15 pp for unpowered sites. Hot showers and wifi included! Absolutely loved it here :)

name: Lake Pukaki
description: Large gravel area where overnight sleeping for self-contained campervans is allowed. Amazing views, can be windy, arrive early for the best level spots with best views.  some slopes. pit toilets, flushing toilets 5 mins drive away at visitors center. lots of space. closest free camping to Mt Cook. $2 showers at Mt Cook.

name: Amberley Beach Camping Grounds
description: This is a no frills campground within walking distance to the beach.  Very basic facilities, (toilet, kitchen, playground).  Dogs are allowed on the southern side of the road.  $5NZ pp for an unpowered site and $25NZ for 2 adults in a powered site.  Nothing special but it is close to the beach and the facilities and grounds are clean. There is a kitchen but it was locked when we were here.

name: North Egmont Retreat
description: This campground is just starting out but is destined to be a great one.  Just down the road from Egmont National Park it has amazing views.  It is a working dairy farm with organic free range pork, mutton and beef for sale.  The camping area is well established but the toilet, shower and kitchen are temporary.  They will be building more permanent structures.  The current facilities are clean but rather small.

name: Bushlands Campground
description: This is a great little Holiday Park with cabins and sites for tents, non-power and power. Very well maintained with a fabulous kitchen complete with everything you will need including frozen pizzas to cook in the wood fired pizza oven.  Nice hike up Fossil Canyon as well.  Off the beaten path but worth the detour.  $20pp camping, add $5 for power.

name: Epworth camp
description:
Beautiful place right by the river.  It is set up as a group retreat center but they have a few powered camp sites as well as a large peaceful area right on the river for tents or vans not requiring power.  Off the beaten track but well worth the trek.  You can't book online but do give them a call because they get busy with groups.
https://www.epworth.co.nz/
027 82 72 03  camp mobile number might be easier, we couldn't get through on the land line.
Not sure about powered sites but unpowered were $12.50 per person.
Small kitchen, toilets, showers and pool, all very clean and well taken care of.

name: Tui Park camping
description: The town of PioPio has set up this lovely spot for campers, vans or tents.  Very clean bathrooms.  Kitchen and showers are available but they ask that you use Kiwicash to use them. $5.00 donation per car so the price is right and the town is worthy of a stop.

name: Kiriwhakapapa campsite
description:
Standard DOC campsite ($10 pppn) at the end the road. 3 grassed areas for camping. Creek on one side of the site. Usually fairly quiet as at the end of a narrow gravel road. 
Walking track to the blue hut starts here
Toilets and covered picnic area provided.

name: Up from DOC Mangawhero campsite
description:
The DOC Mangawhero campsite in Tongariro NP is small and needs to be booked in advance.  If you want to get away from the campervan crowds drive a little further (past the tent sites) and find a few sites further along the gravel track.
Water is available from the river, but otherwise you need to be self-contained.  No cost.

name: Te Kohanga beach camp
description: Lovely, very basic but clean facilities right on the beach.  $25 for 2 people.  Long drop toilets.  Showers (hot during times of sun) Sink for cleaning up otherwise just a field with the waves right out your door.  Not so wild horses frequent the beach and the campground, fun to watch.  Bay is nice for swimming without big waves or strong rips.

name: Thames main carpark freedom camping SC
description: free 20 spots in carpark right on the main Rd and in front of houses. 100m walk to 24hr public toilets and drinking water (for filling bottles) self contained only. 2 nights ma. parking only 5pm till 9am

name: Thames north freedom camping SC
description: parking in front of a park and houses. 2 nights max leave by 9am every day. park between signs about 10 spaces. self contained only

name: SC on water front/highway
description: great spot right on the water. road can get busy in day. no facilities. self contained vehicles only

name: portable drinking water
description: tap labelled as portable drinking water. dump station 10m away is closed

name: free council dump station and potable water
description: 2 lanes. each has free potable water, dump and rinse water

name: self contained freedom campjng
description: 3 nights max 9nly 5pm to 9am. only 4 spots available

name: freedom camping self contained only
description: free camping self contained vehicles only 8 spots leave by 9am 2 nights max some shops near by

name: freedom camping Tairua, paku drive SC only
description: self contained only. about 7 spots with a water view. flushing toilets 5m away. may be closed at night. dump station and water 2 min drive away see the pin. max 2 nights must leave at 9am

name: freedom camping at dump point
description: free freedom camping self contained only at dump point some water views if your lucky. big rig friendly if there is space

name: free dump and potable water
description: free dump potable water and rubbish bin next to freedom camping

name: freedom camping hidden in park on water
description: free camping for self contained. 2 spots only if parked properly.  5 mins walk to flushing toilet.

name: free dump no fresh water
description: free dump station has rinse water but no fresh water

name: freedom camping near main road
description: in carpark for field. free freedom camping self contained only. check sign for where you are allowed to camp. pretty quiet at night but noisy in day. not sure if there are toilets down the back didn't go down there. great for a night. more options in town see camper mate

name: free freedom camping memorial park
description: free freedom camping self contained only. 6 marked spots throughout the carparks there's many signs with photos of the spots

name: 4 freedom camping spots at boat ramp
description: only 4 spots marked in green. seems like you can sleep in if you want. actively patrolled don't break the rules. don't leave anything outside your van including bikes on bike racks. no facilities

name: library
description: great wifi in library. power outlets on tables. open mon Fri 9.30am to 5pm sat Sun 9.30am til 4pm

name: Mount Maunganui Library
description: Fast Wifi, great place to get some work done. Lots of desks with power. Open mon-fri 9.30am-5pm Saturday 9.30am-4pm

name: RV Mega Superstore
description: This place has everything for RV's and campervans. Also some general camping gear. Some items can be a bit pricey but the range is very good. LOTS of plumbing parts, more than a hardware stocks for RV applications. They also do RV repairs if you can't do it yourself.

name: Free freedom camping SC only
description: Free freedom camping SC (self contained) only. max 10 vehicles so get there early to avoid a fine. Spots aren't marked so people keep turning up but you never know if that will land you a fine. Had a quiet night no issues like other places in Tauranga. During the day you can only occupy 1 spot max. No time you have to leave by if you are within the lines of 1 spot. Max 2 nights. I read there are toilets in the massive park complex next door but did not go looking.

name: Corramandel Freedom camping #1
description: Free freedom camping for SC (self contained) only. Leave by 9am. Only 4 spots. Not as scenic as the other spot, but possibly less bugs. Very close to town.

name: $2 hot showers at TECT park
description: $2 hot showers at the freedom camp, anyone can pull into the free camp. you need a kiwi cash fob, it's explained on the TECT park camping pin

name: $5 hot shower
description: $5 hot showers at I site. you have to buy the token at reception

name: $2 wash
description: small wash $2 larger ones get more expensive. dry starts at $2 I ended up spending $2 open 24/7 recommended if you can fit everything in the small machine

name: free dump with potable water
description: free dump with potable water. also a big rubbish bin when I was there

name: $2 showers
description: $2 hot showers, need kiwi cash fob to pay. in underground toilet block. possibly locked at night

name: free hot spring (hot and cold)
description: free hot spring, free parking. up stream is very hot, downstream is a junction with a cold stream where the water mixes. a great place

name: fast free wifi @ library
description: free fast wifi at the library. best bring a short extension cord as many power outlets aren't right next to tables. you can also access the internet around this area outside the library it's intended to be used all around here. no password

name: Aratiatia freedom camping (free)
description: free freedom camp in large un-level carpark. lots of spots max 4 days. no assigned spots park anywhere. basic pit toilet byo paper. a few picnic benches walks and rapids nearby

name: BP
description: Free dump at back of BP. no drinking water at the dump station. there's a tap at the front of the building near the pumps if you need to fill up some bottles

name: free camping @ Reid's farm reserve
description: free camping vehicles and tents. max 3 days. there's porta loos but no water. also a nice day use area. lots of space, no formal parking areas just find a space. gets busy by 6. people still arriving at 9 and squeezing in. it's one big campervan parking lot

name: free hot stream
description: 10 min walk from this free carpark to otumuheke stream. when I went it was warm, but not hot. it isn't that big so I would say weekdays could be less crowded

name: free freedom camping pump track carpark beach front
description: free freedom camping beach front. 3 days max. public toilet provided. don't have to leave by a time. cold outside beach shower

name: free dump station with drinking water
description: at the back of the freedom camping carpark. fresh water and dump on both sides

name: free freedom camping river front SC only
description: heaps of spots no restrictions. river front. there's toilets and a bin. there's a boat ramp so that could get noisy in the morning. was quiet today

name: fast internet @ library
description: fast internet. would also work outside as there's no password. some tables near power outlets, an extension cord could be useful. open mon wed Fri 9am-5.30, Tue Thurs 9am-7pm sat 10-4 sun 1pm-4pm

name: filtered water
description: no thread taps for filling small or large containers. parking available close by. popular with locals. filtered

name: city freedom camping SC only
description: free freedom camping in city center. 5pm to 9am only. 2 nights per month. not busy at all

name: dump station and water @ tui brewery
description: only open during brewery hours usually close @ 5pm. dump and drinking water. see photo the hours vary

name: free freedom camping opposite tui
description: free SC freedom camping opposite tui on nice river. very clean drop toilets always open. road quietens down at night. a great place if you like beer! dump and water at brewery when they are open during the day

name: $1 hot shower @ Wesley center
description: at Wesley church. go into Wesley center then to reception and ask for showers. $1 open open Tues to Friday 10am to 3pm. Can vary. street parking is tight. great if your on foot!

name: Akaroa Bay Freedom Camping
description: Max 2 nights. Must park within marked spaces. 18 spaces, 7 of which are larger. Self-contained only. Toilets 300m away. Freedom camping is prohibited elsewhere around here.

name: free cold indoor showers
description: In front of tennis courts in toilet blocks. No curtains but separate male/female and separate from the rest of the toilet/changing areas. Appears to be locked at night

name: fast wifi @ library
description: fast wifi. there's some seats in the corridor on the way into the library with PowerPoints. otherwise you can go into the library. open mon- Fri 10am 6pm sat 10am 4pm

name: $2.50 hot shower
description: you need to use a kiwi cash fob. if you go here in the camp they are unisex showers so you can share the shower if need be. there's also showers near the servo same price but seperate male/female and sign says if you don't have a kiwi cash fob you can pay cash and borrow theirs. also camping for $15 per night. paid power outlets and dish washing water also if you need it

name: kiwicamp @ roadhouse
description: $15 per night unpowered in the compound with power options. bigger spots here if you need it. paid hot showers, clothes washers and dryers. reception will sell you the required kiwocash  fob for paying for $5. free wifi

name: Carpark
description: Self-contained only, permitted 6pm til 9am, ticket parking otherwise. max one night per month. there's a toilet 5 min walk away. 24hr at 6 Kinross St. Dominos backs onto this carpark if you're hungry! free

name: freedom camping at Taylor Dam
description: free parking SC vehicles only. max 2 nights every 4 weeks. 5 mins walk to flushing toilets. nice views of lake. 10 spots clearly marked

name: free dump @ servo
description: free dump has rinse water and non threaded drinking tap with air hose. if you want threaded tap they are on the 2 outer fuel pumps

name: free freedom camping Jimmy Armers Beach
description: SC only. 6 spots. leave by 7 am. max 1 night in 28 days. flushing toilets and outdoor cold shower. right in a beach and can walk around the peninsula to seals from here. great spots fills up early. max 7.5m long. Seafood food truck next door although not cheap. there's a paid self contained camp site across the road but no toilets or anything there

name: Free freddom camping at Wairau Diversion Reserve
description: Drop toilets, lots of space (it says 75 spots). Currently moved to a close by location due to flood damage. SC only. max 2 nights in a month

name: Free freedom camping in renwick domain car park
description: 6pm til 9am. 10 marked spots only! SC contained vehicles only. Toilets nearby. max 2 nights in a month

name: free freedom camping near lake
description: Great toilets, although kind of close to the road. Max 2 nights in a month. 4 spots only

name: free freedom camping in middle of town
description: max 1 night in 28 days. 5.30pm to 8.30am otherwise it's paid parking. 10 large spots max 10m. free SC only

name: free freedom camping beach front
description: beach front. 6 generous width spots. max 5m long. leave by 7am max 1 night in 28 days. amazing view. gotta walk a while to a toilet

name: paid freedom camping in domain
description: $10 pp pn in honesty box. toilets and hot showers in grey building. quiet

name: glenmark reserve free freedom camping
description: max 2 nights 10 marked spaces. flushing toilets. walking distance to winery in town $10 for a tasting. no dogs allowed. 8pm to 8am only although it fills up early

name: Heathcote Street
description: It's in the Christchurch orange restricted zone-  meaning you can stay for 2 nights then move 500m. At this part of the street there are only industrial buildings. no one present at night. not noisy in morning either. Quiet night no issues. Macca's dining room (round the corner) open till 10pm.

name: Great spot with beautiful view
description:
After a gravel road (no need of 4x4),you'll arrive in a pass with a large place to park. It's also a start for hiking, kind of parking. 
Amazing view on the coast, no facilities, no water.
Perfect for van, but also possible to set a tent on the grass (but it was really windy). 
We were completely alone!

name: fast wifi and power outlets @ maccas
description:
fast wifi and power outlets @ maccas
need to sign up for wifi, but you get freebies with the app if your birthday is this month.. hint.

name: near park
description: had a quiet night here. you can park legally if you have a self contained vehicle but must move 500m after 2 nights. keep a low profile and be respectful with neighbours. the red zone earthquake area here is interesting to explore. no facilities

name: eco-drop recycling
description: here you can recycle pretty much anything. there's also 2 more of these places in Christchurch. it's called eco drop. leave you disposable gas canisters in household hazardous waste red bin 2. you should puncture them before you get here

name: free dump with drinking water
description: drive through access. free. drinking water also

name: Winchester Bridge freedom camping
description: In a park. Not too much highway noise. Nice natural surrounds. 2x pit toilet but smells horrible. Recommended if leaving or arriving in Christchurch. No self-contained restrictions. I assume tents are allowed

name: dump station
description: free dump. Can drive up to it but it would be hard to reverse a big rig back out. could not find drinking water

name: FREE - owaka freedom camping
description: 7 spots behind the pub which offers $5 showers. there's also a dump point and drinking water. apparently fiercely monitored by the council. it's the only free spot around here. public toilets 3 min walk

name: Lumsden railway station freedom camping
description: free freedom camping at old railway station. 24hr toilets. shelter under old railway station platform. strong wifi from library. uses standard library password. self contained vehicles only

name: hot showers $3
description: hot shower in family/disabled toilet in bus waiting area. you have to pay the attendant to get token. cash only. closes at 7pm. most parking is paid except some 30mon spaces just past here on this side of the road

name: hot showers in change rooms
description: in the football field change rooms there are hot showers. they seemed to be open all the time. they are communal open showers. the change rooms aren't labelled male/female so be aware of this. also watch out for questionable characters wandering around.

name: dump with drinking water by donation
description: dump with drinking water. outside the freedom camp location which is amazing. donation requested

name: wild camp on lower hollyford rd
description: in a clearing probably made during road maintenance. room for a small van, kind of level. most of it is raised so not muddy. as far as I can tell it's legal - it doesn't appear as a prohibited freedom camping area on the DOC maps and camping is only prohibited on the main Milford road  on the way here there was some bridge construction might be space there soon too. no facilities. free

name: Milford sound cruise terminal
description: this is where you get Milford sound cruises. even if you don't get a cruise I recommend spending the day enjoying the area. free parking 30 minute walk away. even if you pay $25 for parking it's still a 10 minute walk to the terminal. even just the drive here from te anau is amazing

name: fuel @ milford
description: fuel available 24/7 with credit card. price 266 unleaded 213 diesel

name: Hot showers $2 off-peak $5 peak
description:
In the aquatic center.
$5 or $2 in off-peak times (below)
Weekdays open 6am-9pm. 
Weekdays off-peak is 11am-3pm and 7pm-9pm
Weekends open 8am-6pm
Weekends off-peak is 3pm-6pm.
Private showers in changerooms. have to keep pressing button. Hot water is wam/hot but not steamy. Hairdryers in the changerooms.

name: hot public showers $5
description: $5 only open 9am to 12.30pm and 3.pm to 5.30pm showers close 30 mins earlier

name: free dump with drinking water
description: free dump. dump on one side drinking water on the other. lots of space to turn around. no camping allowed here

name: clay cliffs
description: Amazing clay cliffs structures. they are badlands geology. 10km good quality fairly smooth gravel road to access. google maps will take you here. definitely worth the drive. we came here in the rain and the road was fine.

name: freedom camping at rest stop free
description: free camping at rest stop for self contained vehicles. pit toilet. road is quiet at night. 10 min drive from lake tikapo. very convenient. 4g phone reception with onenz. if you have a dog. the adjacent fields are poisoned for pests don't let you dogs get over the fence

name: free freedom camping near breakwall
description: free camping self contained only. close to beach and breakwall. flushing clean toilets. for sunset you get a good view from here if you walk up the hill. cold outdoor showers

name: kiwicamp hot showers $3
description: $3 for 5 mins. unisex. need a kiwicash fob. they sell them at the bp servo or site nearby. cheapest option around including greymouth. you will have to park on the street

name: Hokitita Gorge
description: 30 min drive from Hokitika on a sealed road. The whole loop walk is 1hr and very good condition fairly level minimal steps and amazing scenery of the blue river. You can turn around at the second bridge and come back along the river for more views if you like. Well worth the drive and walk

name: free dump with drinking water
description: directly behind the museum a 1 lane road accesses it. make sure there's no one coming the other way so you don't get stuck. donations requested. free with drinking water

name: free dump with drinking water
description:
free dump with rinse and drinking water (tiny tap to the right) 
drive through access. hard to see it's opposite the building

name: wild camp with view
description: straight off the road, easy access. no road noise at night. great view. no facilities. 5 mins to Fox glacier town with 24hr toilets. space for about 5 vans. phone reception but no internet on onenz

name: lake Matheson walks
description: amazing place with easy walks. walk to the jetty with reflection of mt cook and Tasman 45 mins return easy grade. the whole lake is 1h25 mins. there's also a cafe at the start with great views. free entry/parking

name: Fox glacier view
description: best place to see the glacier since the walk to the base of the glacier has been closed. it's 10 mins drive from the town. no walking required. you can also see the alps

name: free freedom camping southern headland
description: free carpark camping has toilet and cold outdoor shower. self contained only. good views very windy but van didn't shake more the cold air that was the issue. great sunset here. good phone reception but the upload speed was terrible

name: recycling and car charging
description: only recycling and car charging around for about 2 hrs. can recycle almost all domestic products see photos for car chargers there are 2 types

name: wild camping near train tracks
description: off the road and out of town. trains do run at night but the tracks are good quality so not too noisy. no issues. no facilities. 5 mins drive to arthurs pass village

name: free caves and glow worms
description: come in the afternoon for the free cave walk on the ruakuri walk. says 30 mins but more like an hour as you will likely stop for the amazing sights. then have dinner and walk to the swing bridge (it doesn't actually swing it's on the map at the start) for more glow worms than you can imagine. best wait till it's pitch black. they are along the steep rock walls on the way down to the big bridge and further on. highly recommended.

name: Carters Tyre Service
description: great friendly LPGas fill up for $17NZ for a 9kg tank refill.

name: Hamilton gardens
description: about 15 different country themed gardens to check out plus nice places to relax on the river. free entry and parking

name: econowaste Silverdale RECYCLING
description: can recycle pretty much anything here including camping stove butane cylinders

name: north head historic reserve
description: lots of tunnels to walk through in the old batteries. the best I have ever seen. closes at 8pm. free. great views of the ocean and city

name: Hanmer Springs River Reserve Freedom Camping
description:
Close to a shallow river, just outside of Hanmer Springs town.
Only 10 spots to park up at a time (along the fence line. It’s very clearly marked where to go). 
Free for the night.
Clean flushing toilets, with toilet paper & soap.

name: Waiteti Trout Stream Holiday Park & Backpackers
description:
Found this place on our way to Hamurana Reserve freedom Camping where we found out that Camping is prohibitet there.
Nice little Campground with ablutions, kitchen, playground, laundry and a gaming room with pool and pingpong table, 20NZD ppn. Cheapest of the Campgrounds around.
We came without pre booking and the lady was very friendly! Not sure if it gets busy in high season...

name: Aussie Bay DOC site
description: Such a gorgeous spot right on the water. Views of the hills. Not many spaces to park. One toilet. People swimming & kayaking.

name: Freedom Camping Cox's Bay Reserve
description: Parking spot suitable for RV, no el.plugs or toilets available. Close to main road it could be a little bit noisy at night.

name: Mt. Manaia
description: Parking place where is possible stay over night between arrows for 4 cars. Maximum one night stay, max.vehicles lenght is 6 metres, no camping with tent. Entrance place to hike to Mt Manaia (419m). Hike for cca 1,5hour.

name: Hamurana Free Camp
description: Free camping with toilet facilities.  16km from Rotorua.

name: Kidds Bush
description:
Nice place in front of the lake. 6 toilets. 
You must drive 6km from the main road. Trees and grass and beach. 
Free entrance.

name: Lookout parking
description: 7 parking spots with amazing view of town. There is camera on roundabout near by. Unfortunately far away from toilets. Can be a little bit crowded since there is a "chill" zone for locals couple of meters up but we did not have problem with that.

name: Westland District Library
description: Public library with free wifi. It is password protected, so make sure to go when it's open.

name: Te Puru Creek Road
description: Perfect spot next to the river with well-maintained grass with no through route. We didn’t see another person.

name: Bank of New Zealand
description: Super Fast Open free WiFi with benches out front. Just sit out with a phone and no one will notice.

name: kiwicamp
description: Hot shower (you have to pay with kiwi camp badge)

name: Waikawa Bay Picnic Area
description: Free outdoor cold shower at the toilet block

name: free toilet kiwi camp
description: Free toilet in kiwi camp (accessible even if you are not from the kiwi camp

name: Lake Okaro Campsite
description:
Beautiful campsite for motorhomes and also tents right on Lake Okaro for free.
Some trees and a lot of space.
You can also swim in the lake  -> but check the algae level online before (QR code on the sign by the water)

name: Freedom Camping in Whanganui
description:
Nice place with clean public toilets and running water.
Avoid the left half of the meadow, people seem to live there permanently.

name: Ohinepane Camping Area
description:
Campsite with lots of space for motorhomes and tents.
There are two toilets (without water), and you can also swim in the river.
8 NZD per adult.

name: Te Rauone Beach
description: Flat parking ground with sign that it is allowed to camp with self contained vehicles. This spot is not on CamperMate and Rankers NZ. Close to the Royal Albatros Center and Pinguine watching. Next to a small beach.

name: Dunback Domain Campground
description:
Lots of space for motorhomes or tents.
Clean toilets, shady places and close to the stream. (Be careful of toxic algae!)

5 NZD p.P.

name: Kiosk Creek
description: This place is near a other expensiv campground and much cheaper. 15NZD pP and night.

name: Shady place between street and a small beach
description: A small way from the street to a small beach. Space for about 5 campervans. Mainly hidden from the street. Some shady spots. Some are flat some are less flat. The best spot we could found close to farewell spit and wharariki beach. We assume for self contained cars it should be allowed but no guarantee.

name: Gillespie Beach DOC Campsite
description:
Very nice campsite near the beach (Beach not suitable for swimming).
Prior online booking is desirable, but there is no internet and there was still enough space for us.  Self check in. 10 NZD per person

There is a really nice hiking trail to a mining tunnel with a sea view.

name: Tree Top Campsite
description:
Free campsite with toilet.
Gravel place.

name: Mongeroa
description: This is a beautiful camping ground with a nice landscape around. They have a toilet and much place to stay for a really cheap price (20NZ per night). The campsite is very well maintained and the people are really friendly. In the near you can see the rocks and a beach with round stones, go and have a walk to the wood with the tall trees(hundreds of years old) 15 minutes far away. We will come again.

name: DOC Diamond Lake Picknick  and Camping area
description: The place is located by the lake.  The tent and campsite spaces are limited.  Self check-in and registration.  There is a public toilet.  Be careful when driving: there are some potholes on the way.

name: The Point Campsite and Bed & Breakfast
description:
Beautiful campsite on a sheep farm (with shearing show 15 NZ$ pP).
Directly at the sea.
Public beach showers nearby.
We paid a total of 25 NZD for two adults per night with a tent, so very cheap.

name: The Cowshed Camping Site
description: Simple and quiet campsite with warm showers, toilets, a nice lounge and a very simple kitchen, without a stove but with a kettle, coffee maker, toaster and a way to put your dishes. The place is very quiet, a bit off the main road and is lovingly run by a nice couple. I paid 15 NZD for the overnight stay in a camper van. No WiFi, but if you have a SIM card you can get 4G.

name: Ahaura Domain Campground
description: Nice spacey Campsite with all necessary facilities. Extra kitchen. Big trees. Not busy on this tuesday.

name: Beach Road Holiday Park
description: Nice campsite with all you need. Lots of permanent campers in interesting busses/buildings/caravans. If reception closed, just take a site.

name: Huge site 200m off the road
description: Suitable for any vehicle. Close to river. Fine view. Nice and quiet.

name: Huge place off the road
description: Big space with a fantastic view of the valley. No amenities and too far from the river to get water from there.

name: Missing sock laundry station and shower
description: Next to the laundry ! 2$ for 2mn. Shower belongs to the Alpine Jonction Lodge but is open for others

name: Public showers - visitor center
description: 2$ per 2 minutes. Open 24/7 and very clean !

name: Warkworth museum
description: Freedom camping, 3 spots, toilets nearby

name: Takaka campground
description: Freedom camping with 11 places. Shower and toilets nearby (500m)

name: Greta Valley Camping Ground
description:
Nice campsite with equipped kitchen, shower, washing machine, dryer.
A little close to the noisy street but there are also places further away.
15 NZD pP for unpewered suite and 3 for shower or washing machine (although you don't need a choin or anything).

name: DOC lake lanthe / matahi
description: Campsite located right on the edge of lake Lanthe/matahi. Approx 10 spots. Bathrooms and sink, no potable water. Pay for use at site: $8/night per adult, $4/night per child (5-17), no charge below 5 years old. Pack out trash, no dogs, no fires, camping stoves only.

name: Salmon farm parking lot (kinda)
description: Parking lot just after salmon farm cafe, designated zone, max two nights. All rigs welcome - rv, car, tent. Big rigs could fit, depends on how many people are already there. Dogs on leash, no potable water (could get at cafe if open). Restrooms with running water. No dish washing. Camping spot! not anything fancy or scenic.

name: Pleasant Flat Campground
description: Established DOC site off the highway. Online booking prior are required, can pay in person but not recommended during busy season. $10/night adult, $5/night child. Restrooms, covered picnic areas, detailed map of hikes in the area. Non potable water. Great cell service. No dumping, no trash.

name: Lake Paringa Campground
description: DOC established campsite, right off highway on the lake. Boat ramp access point. Toilets, no cell service, potable water, no dogs allowed. Pre booking recommended $15/night

name: Beautiful freedom camping spot
description:
There are no signs that forbid camping at this spot. 
Toilets, water, benches & good connection with OneNZ & 2degrees

name: Lake Rotomanu Freedom Camp
description: Large parking area on the lake. Boat launch and parking for campers/trailers. 5 NSC spot available otherwise you must be self contained.

name: Raumati Beach Freedom Camping
description:
Designated for Self-Contained Vehicles only.
Council controlled site. 1 night max stay.
24 hr toilets nearby. Daytime change room and toilets. Adjacent to the beach. Nearby boat ramp, restaurant bar, gardens, playground and small shopping village.  Good fishing. 3 vehicle limit. Shared carpark with daytrippers and boaties.

name: Porika road
description:
Just of Porika road in a nice Beech forest clearing. Water is a bit of a walk down the track opposite side of the road.
No facilities. Take all your rubbish.
The short access track is muddy. 4x4 only!

name: Mill Flat
description: DOC campsite in Richmond Forest Park.   Nice campsite in beech forest next to river.  15-20 spaces. Long drop toilets. 4x4 access  only.

name: Rotorua Thermal Holiday Park
description:
Established campground in Rotorua. Tent sites, hook up/non-hook up as well as cabins
Showers, bathrooms, laundry and community kitchens.  Take a dip in their thermal pool😃

name: Interisland Ferry Terminal
description: Girl at ticket booth was kind enough to let us park our campvan overnight in the short term parking lot.  Toilets available during business hours. Closed at night

name: Charleston Motor Camp
description:
Campground with powered sites and cabins 
Laundry, kitchen space, bathrooms & showers.  Super friendly staff.  4bars (3G) T-Mobile

name: Rainforest Retreat Holiday Park
description:
Holiday park with power hookups or not, cottages, laundry, kitchens, sauna and hot pools.  Restaurant/bar on site
www.rainforest.nz
